definition: lit. born in the morning and dying at dusk (idiom)/fig. ephemeral/transient
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The mage mystically attacks an ephemeral object.
sentences.chinese: 那法师神秘的攻击一个朝生暮死物体。

definition: a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
lit. to be born, to grow old, to get sick and to die/fig. the fate of humankind (i.e. mortality)
lit. short-lived cicada does not know the seasons; fig. to see only a small piece of the big picture
pinyin: hui4 gu1 bu4 zhi1 chun1 qiu1

definition: life (as the characteristic of living beings)/living being/creature/CL:個|个[ge4],條|条[tiao2]
human life as the morning dew (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
lit. mole cricket and ants/fig. tiny individuals with no power
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
